title: Authors and Citation
text: Jeanne Tous. Author, maintainer. Julien Chiquet. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Tous J, Chiquet J (2025). normalblockr: implementation Normal block model, normal data cluster effect. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {normalblockr: An implementation of Normal block model, normal data with cluster effect},   author = {Jeanne Tous and Julien Chiquet},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

what: An implementation of Normal block model, normal data with cluster effect
title: An implementation of Normal block model, normal data with cluster effect
text: Normal-Block graphical model designed multivariate analysis continuous data. clusters variables builds Graphical-Lasso infer network statistical dependencies clusters.

title: An implementation of Normal block model, normal data with cluster effect
text: can install development version normalblockr GitHub :

title: An implementation of Normal block model, normal data with cluster effect
text: fitting done using function normal_block. object class normal_data must created (using observations Y covariates X) used input normal_block. normal_block parameters allow choose sparse / sparse models, fixed unknown blocks… package comes small artificial data set simulated model.
code: testdata <- readRDS("testdata/testdata_normal.RDS") Y        <- testdata$Y ; X <- testdata$X C        <- testdata$parameters$C ; Q <- ncol(C) data     <- normal_data$new(Y, X) model    <- normal_block(data, blocks = C)

title: An implementation of Normal block model, normal data with cluster effect
code: model    <- normal_block(data, blocks = C, sparsity = TRUE)

title: An implementation of Normal block model, normal data with cluster effect
code: model    <- normal_block(data, blocks = 2:5, sparsity = TRUE) model$plot_criteria() model_BIC <- model$get_best_model("BIC")

what: R6 abstract class for a generic sparse Normal Block model — NB
title: R6 abstract class for a generic sparse Normal Block model — NB
text: R6 abstract class generic sparse Normal Block model R6 abstract class generic sparse Normal Block model

title: R6 abstract class for a generic sparse Normal Block model — NB
text: data object NBData class, responses design matrix

title: R6 abstract class for a generic sparse Normal Block model — NB
text: inference_method inference procedure used (heuristic integrated EM) n number samples p number responses per sample d number variables (dimensions X) Q number blocks n_edges number edges network (non null coefficient sparse precision matrix OmegaQ) model_par list matrices model parameters: B (covariates), dm1 (species variance), OmegaQ (groups precision matrix)) nb_param number parameters model objective evolution objective function (V)EM algorithm loglik (variational lower bound) deviance (variational lower bound) BIC (variational lower bound) entropy Entropy conditional distribution applicable ICL variational lower bound ICL EBIC variational lower bound EBIC criteria vector loglik, BIC number parameters sparsity (overall sparsity parameter) sparsity_weights (weights associated pair groups) sparsity_term (sparsity_term term log-likelihood due sparsity) get_res_covariance whether residual covariance diagonal spherical memberships cluster memberships clustering given list elements contained cluster cluster_sizes given vector cluster sizes elements_per_cluster given list elements contained cluster

title: R6 abstract class for a generic sparse Normal Block model — NB
text: B regression matrix dm1 diagonal vector inverse variance matrix (variables level) C matrix groups memberships (posterior probabilities) OmegaQ groups inverse variance matrix gamma variance posterior distribution W mu mean posterior distribution W kappa vector zero-inflation probabilities alpha vector groups probabilities M variational mean posterior distribution W S variational diagonal variances posterior distribution W ll_list list log-lik (elbo) values

title: R6 abstract class for a generic sparse Normal Block model — NB
code: NB$plot_network(   type = c("partial_cor", "support"),   output = c("igraph", "corrplot"),   edge.color = c("#F8766D", "#00BFC4"),   remove.isolated = FALSE,   node.labels = NULL,   layout = igraph::layout_in_circle,   plot = TRUE )

title: R6 abstract class for a generic sparse Normal Block model — NB
text: type edge value network. Either "precision" (coefficient precision matrix) "partial_cor" (partial correlation species). output Output type. Either `igraph` (network) `corrplot` (adjacency matrix) edge.color Length 2 color vector. Color positive/negative edges. Default `c("#F8766D", "#00BFC4")`. relevant igraph output. remove.isolated `TRUE`, isolated node remove plotting. relevant igraph output. node.labels vector character. labels nodes. default use column names ot response matrix. layout optional igraph layout. relevant igraph output. plot logical. final network displayed sent back user. Default `TRUE`.

R6 class for normal-block model with unknown Q (number of groups) — NB_changing_sparsity
text: subsamples list vectors describing subsamples. number vectors (list length) determines number subsamples used stability selection. Automatically set 20 subsamples size `10*sqrt(n)` `n >= 144` `0.8*n` otherwise following Liu et al. (2010) recommendations. n_subsamples number subsamples create subsamples given

title: NB_control — NB_control
text: Control model settings various optimization parameters

title: NB_control — NB_control
code: NB_control(   niter = 100,   threshold = 1e-04,   sparsity_weights = NULL,   sparsity_penalties = NULL,   n_sparsity_penalties = 30,   min_ratio = 0.01,   fixed_tau = FALSE,   clustering_init = NULL,   verbose = TRUE,   heuristic = FALSE,   noise_covariance = c("diagonal", "spherical"),   clustering_approx = c("ward2", "kmeans", "sbm") )

title: NB_control — NB_control
text: niter number iterations model optimization threshold loglikelihood / elbo threshold optimization stops sparsity_weights weights penalty applied case sparsity required, non-0 values diagonal mean diagonal shall penalized (default non-penalized diagonal 1s -diagonal) sparsity_penalties list penalties user wants test, parameters used penalties specified n_sparsity_penalties number penalties test. min_ratio ratio sparsity max penalty (0 edge penalty) min penalty test fixed_tau whether tau fixed clustering_init optimization useful calls fixed_Q models stability_selection clustering_init proposal initial value clustering, Q unknown, can list one clustering Q value verbose telling information printed optimization heuristic weather use heuristic approach . Default FALSE noise_covariance variance can variable specific ("diagonal", default) common ("spherical") clustering_approx use clustering heuristic inference method

title: Generate Normal Block Data — generate_normal_block_data
text: function draw data normal block model (see details). function return generated data corrresponding model parameters, list.

title: Generate Normal Block Data — generate_normal_block_data
code: generate_normal_block_data(   n = 100,   p = 40,   d = 1,   Q = 3,   kappa = 0,   omega_structure = "erdos-renyi",   u_v = c(0.3, 0.1),   SNR = 0.75,   alpha = rep(1/Q, Q),   range_X = c(0, 10),   range_D = c(0.5, 1.5) )

title: Generate Normal Block Data — generate_normal_block_data
text: n number individuals. Default 100. p number variables. Default 40. d number covariates. Default 1. Q number groups. Default 3. kappa vector (scalar) variable-wise probability zero inflation. Default 0. omega_structure structure graph precision matrix groups built. Can symmetric matrix Q rows/columns character picked "erdos-renyi", "preferential_attachment", "community" case graph drawn sensible generation parameters. See generate_precision_matrix details. u_v two-size vector positive numbers u v controlling generation precision matrix Omega: u -diagonal elements precision matrix, controlling magnitude partial correlations v positive number added diagonal elements precision matrix. default value c(0.3, 0.1). SNR Signal noise ratio: magnitude regression parameters B adjusted tr(var(XB)) tr(Sigma) match desried SNR. alpha Q-size vector group proportion. Default rep(1/Q, Q) range_X 2-size vector defining range uniform distribution used draw values X, regressor matrix. Default c(0, 10) range_D 2-size vector defining range uniform distribution used draw values D, diagonal matrix variances variables. Default c(0.5, 1.5)

title: Generate Normal Block Data — generate_normal_block_data
text: named list following element - Y matrix responses - X regressor/design matrix - list model parameters, encompassing    - B: matrix regression coefficients    - C: matrix group membership    - D: diagonal matrix variance variables    - Omega: precision matrix groups    - Sigma: covariance matrix groups    - kappa: vector ZI inflation proabilities (one per variable)

what: Creates appropriate new normal block model depending on the parametrization — get_model
title: Creates appropriate new normal block model depending on the parametrization — get_model
text: Creates appropriate new normal block model depending parametrization

title: Creates appropriate new normal block model depending on the parametrization — get_model
code: get_model(   data,   blocks,   sparsity = 0,   zero_inflation = FALSE,   control = NB_control() )

title: Creates appropriate new normal block model depending on the parametrization — get_model
text: data contains matrix responses (Y) design matrix (X). blocks either integer (number blocks), vector integer (list possible number block) p * Q matrix (indicating block membership known) sparsity boolean say whether model changing penalty float run model single penalty value zero_inflation boolean indicate Y zero-inflated adjust fitted model consequence control list-like structure detailed control parameters generated normal_block_control() collections sparse models

title: Normal-block model — normal_block
text: Fit normal-block model variational heuristic algorithm

title: Normal-block model — normal_block
code: normal_block(   data,   blocks,   sparsity = 0,   zero_inflation = FALSE,   control = NB_control() )

title: Normal-block model — normal_block
text: data contains matrix responses (Y, n x p) design matrix (X, n x d)." blocks either integer (number blocks), vector integer (list possible number block) p * Q matrix (indicating block membership known) sparsity either TRUE run optimization different sparsity penalty values float run model single sparsity penalty value zero_inflation boolean indicate Y zero-inflated adjust fitted model consequence control list-like structure detailed control parameters generated NB_control().

title: Normal-block model — normal_block
text: R6 object one NB classes

title: Normal-block model — normal_block
code: ## Normal Data ex_data <- generate_normal_block_data(n=50, p=50, d=1, Q=3) data <- NBData$new(ex_data$Y, ex_data$X) my_normal_block <- normal_block(data, blocks = 1:6) #> Fitting a diagonal normal-block model with unknown Q  #> 	number of blocks = 1            	number of blocks = 2            	number of blocks = 3            	number of blocks = 4            	number of blocks = 5            	number of blocks = 6            #> DONE if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ my_normal_block$plot(c("deviance", "BIC", "ICL")) Y_hat <- my_normal_block$get_best_model()$fitted plot(data$Y, Y_hat, log = "xy"); abline(0,1) } # } ## Normal Data with Zero Inflation ex_data_zi <- generate_normal_block_data(n=50, p=50, d=1, Q=3, kappa = rep(0.5,50)) zidata <- NBData$new(ex_data_zi$Y, ex_data_zi$X) my_normal_block <- normal_block(zidata, blocks = 1:6, zero_inflation = TRUE) #> Fitting a diagonal normal-block model with unknown Q  #> 	number of blocks = 1            	number of blocks = 2            	number of blocks = 3            	number of blocks = 4            	number of blocks = 5            	number of blocks = 6            #> DONE
